item.title: Attention To Detail
item.description: Why It Matters If it makes my eyes bleed, am I going to be motivated to help? Attention To Detail Is Important Programming is a detail oriented art. If you neglect details you will make lots of mistakes, your code will be bad, your programs will have errors, you will cause yourself (and others) much undue pain debugging problems you could have easily avoided. Caring is important If you don’t care about something then you won’t do a good job.

item.title: Use An IDE
item.description: In 60 Seconds Use Visual Studio for Windows. It’s FREE! It does everything you want. Download: Visual Studio Visual Studio is not VSCode, they are different products. Visual Studio comes with a compiler, no need for MinGW. See also I Am Not Using Windows See also I Want To Use Something Else Visual Studio doesn’t configure itself, you still have to do that, but doing so should be much easier for beginners as compared to VSCode.

item.title: Where Do I Start
item.description: Where Do I Start Begin by reading your textbook. But I Don’t Have A Textbook Use the one from your syllabus. But I Don’t Have A Syllabus You probably do. Ask your TAs or your professor for book recommendations. Anyway, you could try a free one like this Free CompSci Curriculum But I Don’t Have A Syllabus Textbook Then get yourself a book, there are free books available. Paid books are still generally better.

item.title: Why C++ Instead of C
item.description: What Is The Difference? The difference from C to C++ is very great. Most C++ code is not valid C code. Most idiomatic C code is very poor C++ code. Why Should I Use C++? C++ has many features in both the language and its standard library including, in no particular order Metaprogramming Variadic Templates Lambdas Concurrency and Parellelism Atomics Structured Bindings Regular Expressions Strings, Arrays & Dictionaries Unicode Support Date & Time Functions File And Directory Management Random Number Generation Function Overloads Operator Overloads Classes Inheritance Polymorphism Iterators Ranges Concepts Views & Spans Exceptions Variant Plus there exist many other common useful libraries for things like
